intro: Eritrichium grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered biscuit flower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant's leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
